abstract: Members of several Native American tribes stage protest in North Dakota against construction of Dakota Access underground oil pipeline by Energy Transfer Partners; tribes say plans would intrude on culturally significant lands in North and South Dakota and could endanger local water supplies; company argues pipeline will help local economies and is safer than transporting oil above ground in trucks or trains.
lead_paragraph: A federal court will hear arguments Wednesday in a suit to stop the Dakota Access pipeline, which the Standing Rock Sioux tribe says threatens water supplies and sacred lands.
snippet: A federal court will hear arguments Wednesday in a suit to stop the Dakota Access pipeline, which the Standing Rock Sioux tribe says threatens water supplies and sacred lands....

headline.main: Occupying the Prairie: Tensions Rise as Tribes Move to Block a Pipeline
headline.print_headline: Tension on the Plains as Tribes Move to Block a Pipeline
